WITH stats_calculadas AS (
    SELECT
        c.name AS client_name,
        AVG(r.reading_kwh) FILTER (WHERE r.ref_date >= CURRENT_DATE - INTERVAL '3 months') AS last_3m_avg,
        AVG(r.reading_kwh) AS historical_avg,
        COALESCE(STDDEV(r.reading_kwh), 0) AS stddev
    FROM customers c
    JOIN contracts ct ON c.id = ct.customer_id
    JOIN readings r ON ct.id = r.contract_id
    GROUP BY c.name
)SELECT
    client_name,
    ROUND(last_3m_avg::numeric, 2) AS last_3m_avg_kwh,
    ROUND(historical_avg::numeric, 2) AS historical_avg_kwh,
    stddev,
    ABS((last_3m_avg - historical_avg) / stddev) as z_score,
    CASE
        WHEN stddev = 0 THEN 'no historical data'
        WHEN last_3m_avg IS NULL THEN 'no recent data'
        WHEN ABS((last_3m_avg - historical_avg) / stddev) > 1.5 THEN 'outlier'
        ELSE 'normal'
    END AS status FROM stats_calculadas;

SELECT 
    c.id AS client_id,
    c.name AS client_name,
    jsonb_agg(
        jsonb_build_object(
            'contract_id', co.id,
            'is_active', co.is_active,
            'readings', (
                SELECT jsonb_object_agg(re.ref_date, re.reading_kwh)
                FROM readings re
                WHERE re.contract_id = co.id
            )
        )
    ) AS contract_series
FROM customers c
JOIN contracts co ON c.id = co.customer_id
GROUP BY c.id, c.name;

import pandas as pd

# 1. Recupera os dados dos inputs
# Input 0: Relat√≥rio da IA (Structured Output Parser)
# Input 1: Dados do Postgres (Leituras agregadas)
relatorio_input = _('AI Agent1').all()
postgres_input = _('Query Series Consumo').all()

# 2. Extrai a lista de clientes do relat√≥rio da IA
# Seguindo a estrutura: item['output']['relatorio_geral']['analise_detalhada']
raw_data = relatorio_input[0].json
relatorio_geral = raw_data.get('output', {}).get('relatorio_geral', raw_data.get('relatorio_geral', {}))
clientes_ia = relatorio_geral.get('analise_detalhada', [])

# 3. Converte os dados do Postgres para um dicion√°rio para busca r√°pida
# Chave: nome do cliente (em min√∫sculas), Valor: contract_series
postgres_map = {}
for item in postgres_input:
    data = item.json
    if 'client_name' in data:
        # Padronizamos a chave para evitar erros de case-sensitive
        nome_chave = str(data['client_name']).lower().strip()
        postgres_map[nome_chave] = data.get('contract_series', [])

# 4. Realiza o "Merge" manual injetando o hist√≥rico
for cliente in clientes_ia:
    # Busca o nome no relat√≥rio (campo 'cliente') e tenta achar no mapa do Postgres
    nome_busca = str(cliente.get('cliente', '')).lower().strip()
    
    # Se encontrar no banco de dados, anexa ao campo 'historico_contratos'
    # Caso contr√°rio, retorna uma lista vazia
    cliente['historico_contratos'] = postgres_map.get(nome_busca, [])

# 5. Prepara o retorno final mantendo a estrutura do relat√≥rio
return {
    "data_referencia": relatorio_geral.get('data_referencia'),
    "resumo_executivo": relatorio_geral.get('resumo_executivo'),
    "analise_detalhada": clientes_ia,
    "recomendacao_imediata": relatorio_geral.get('recomendacao_imediata')
}
